paragraphs.text: Eight ways to kill your enemies with kindness.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: They call it "the herpes of the craft world"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "They" being some Machiavellian Australians who have launched a website that lets you anonymously ship glitter to your enemies
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: For just A$9.99 (? 5), you can reduce grown men to fairy princesses and provide your frenemies with hours of vacuuming fun
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For years, your victim will find specks of glitter everywhere they go
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They will serve as ineradicable sparkles of your vengeance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Best of all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you will be able to exert great power without feeling great responsibility
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I mean
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it's glitter, right?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Who can stay mad at glitter?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: don't get too excited
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: ShipYourEnemiesGlitter.com has become a victim of its own success
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The site launched on Monday and then crashed within hours because of the level of demand
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It seems there are an awful lot of people out there who have been waiting all their lives for a site offering glitter-based revenge with international delivery options
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At the time of writing, the website was back up
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: all services were temporarily suspended because"you guys have a sick fascination with shipping people glitter"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: So disappointing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What is an ethical avenger to do now?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Don't worry, while our Australian friends get their glitter game back on track, here are some other ways you can be kind to be cruel
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: This is pretty much the glitter trick, just with lifestyle advice
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At first your nemesis will be thrilled that you have signed them up to Goop, Gwyneth Paltrow's blog and email newsletter
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They'll discover food allergies they never knew they had!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They'll learn how to crochet quinoa!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Soon, however, the interminable emails will become a nuisance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Your nemesis will decide they've had enough
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But no matter how many times they hit that unsubscribe button, they will find trying to consciously uncouple from the site to be nigh impossible
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Somewhere deep inside their soul, like a speck of glitter on otherwise spotless cashmere carpet, Gwyneth will be present
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: she will be judging
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As Marx would have said if he'd ever come across a Starbucks: caffeine is the amphetamine of the people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It can traumatise the body and wreak havoc on the soul
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You can read more in-depth reporting about this in this excellent Goop post: "Foods that cause pain."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So save your caffeine-dependent foes from themselves via this simple but powerful caffeine trick
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Their adrenal glands will thank you for it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Their sanity won't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Gosh! You tell your selfie-obsessed frenemy
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: You have the sort of face that could grace a thousand articles, advertisements, and corporate websites
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Have you ever thought of a career as a stock photography model?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Having planted this lucrative seed in your narcissist-nemesis's mind, sit back and watch as their mugshots take on a life of their own
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Perhaps the Guardian will use their photo to illustrate an advice column headlined"I fantasise about group sex with old, obese men"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or maybe they will pop up, nestling a watermelon and a gun, in a Buzzfeed listicle of unexplainable stock photos
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The possibilities are endless
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A supposedly fun thing they will never do again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This revenge-hack kills two annoying birds with one stone by using the power of niche dating websites to find your nemesis the love they so richly deserve
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they like bad boys
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , I suggest meet-an-inmate. com
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they find sharing difficult
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: , then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: connect them with an Ayn Rand enthusiast over at The Atlasphere
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or just find them a Sea Captain Date in the hope that you'll never have to see them again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: There' s something for everyone online!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is one of the most egregiously irritating things you can do to a person in the 21st century
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But make sure they are also slightly passive-aggressive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Silence does not always mark wisdom," said Samuel Taylor Coleridge
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "Every artist was first an amateur," said Ralph Waldo Emerson
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The recipient will feel motivated, but also slightly denigrated
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is a long-term play that requires you discovering some sort of unpleasant fact that you can then prove with equations and name after someone you dislike
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: assuming you can do all the above
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: you will be rewarded via the Third Law of Spiteful Science
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: a body, once immortalised by science, will feel grateful for this afterlife, yet mortified by their legacy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Take Murphy, for example, forever associated with the idea that anything that can go wrong, will go wrong
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not to mention Pavlov's poor dog, whose psychic secretions will never be forgotten
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The above examples are for illustrative purposes only
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: please do not try any of these at home
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Specifically
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I find myself suddenly signed up to any Goop newsletters
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I will respond swiftly and with glitter
paragraphs.label: assumption
